intro: Stellaria potaninii, commonly known as the mountain starwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits called capsules. Stellaria potaninii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
